instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..
definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.BKL_EN: What is BKL_EN? BKL_EN enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKL” before “_EN”. “BKL” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. .
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: 2012 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video output
threads.message:
hi guys
having a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board. pretty clean and well kept condition,nothing spilled on it.

it can power up,all power rail present, you can hear the chime, but nothing on screen.
not the no back light issue, it's no image at all,same as external.

as for measurements, <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GXF</SIGNAL> = 0.8-0.9 ,CPU roughly 0.8 , <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_LCD</SIGNAL>=0V,  <SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL>=0V.

really have no idea now, tried to heat up (wram)the GPU with heat gun for about 30 secons, 200-250C. nothing change.

doubting on GPU, any ideas?

I searched a bit on forum,seems like someone else got this similar issues before but didn't get solved, any one came across this and solutions?

thanks in advanced.

threads.title: 2012 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video output
threads.message: <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>? Tried external LCD with internal disconnected?

threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>=3.3
yes, tried external but still no image

threads.title: 2012 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video output
threads.message: Could still be a bad GPU. I had one this week that did not react to heat, replaced GPU and worked.

threads.message: Im thinking the same thing. hate to call customer in this situation and add the price. cost of this chipset is around 60, should've charged more
